meanings.definition: A hair-like structure on the surface of a cell or microorganism.
meanings.sent1: Under the microscope, the tiny pilus on the bacterium was visible.
meanings.sent2: She found a pilus on the leaf, thinking it was a small hair.
meanings.sent3: The pilus on the germ looked like a little antenna waving around.
meanings.sent4: The pilus of the cell reached out like a delicate hand trying to grab something.
meanings.sent5: The pilus on the microorganism was like a tiny flag waving in the wind.

meanings.sent1: Her long pilus shone in the sunlight as she walked.
meanings.sent2: He found a black pilus on his shirt, probably from his dog.
meanings.sent3: The pilus on the floor seemed to be trying to escape from the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: The pilus on his head stood straight up like a soldier at attention.
meanings.sent5: The golden pilus on the doll was the only one that sparkled.
